questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
Which logic gate is given in the figure?

C
A
B
questions.concept: NAND gate truth table

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText:
Given energy density equation for unsteady flow:

ρ/2 × A₁/Bt² + P + ρvg(h + Bt)

Find dimension of A and B.
questions.concept: Dimensional analysis of fluid flow equations

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An α-particle is projected from infinity towards a fixed gold nucleus with energy 7.7 MeV. Find minimum distance between α-particle and gold nucleus:
questions.concept: Energy conservation in Coulomb scattering

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: From a ring of area 1 m² and resistance 100Ω a magnetic field B = sin(100t) T is passing perpendicular to the ring. Find heat produced in one time period in joule:
questions.concept: Heat dissipation due to induced EMF

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A charge q₁ = 10⁻⁶C is at (0, 0, 0). Another charge q₂ = 2μC is taken from A (4, 4, 2) to B(2, 2, 1). Find work done by external:
questions.concept: Work done in electric field

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: An electromagnetic wave has electric field component Ez = (63 V/m) sin(ωt–kx). The corresponding magnetic field component should be:
questions.concept: Relationship between E and B in EM waves

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: As shown in the figure find volume flow rate at cross section-B. Given area at A is 6 cm² and at B is 3 cm², height difference is 5 cm:
questions.concept: Continuity equation and Bernoulli's principle

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: As shown in the figure find force required to move rod with constant velocity 15 m/s in uniform magnetic field B = 4T, length = 2m, resistance = 2Ω:
questions.concept: Force on current carrying conductor in magnetic field

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A gas based geyser heats water at rate of 5 litres per minute from 27° to 87°C. If the rate of consumption of energy by gas geyser is x × 10⁴ W. Find value of 'x':
questions.concept: Rate of heat transfer

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Given acceleration as a function of time a = t³î + (3t/4)ĵ. Initially (t = 0) position is 0î + 0ĵ + 0k̂ and particle is at rest. Find position and velocity at any instant:
questions.concept: Integration of acceleration to find velocity and position

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: In the diagram shown time taken by a pulse to travel on string 1 is t₁ while on string 2 is t₂. Find t₁/t₂. Given μ₁ = 2 × 10⁻⁴ kg/m, μ₂ = 4 × 10⁻⁴ kg/m:
questions.concept: Wave speed on strings with different linear mass densities

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A light wave described by E = 60 (sin (3 × 10¹⁵)t + sin (12 × 10¹⁵)t) (in SI unit) falls on a metal surface of work function 2.8 eV. The maximum kinetic energy of ejected photon is approximately (in eV). Given: h = 6.6 × 10⁻³⁴ J-s:
questions.concept: Einstein's photoelectric equation

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two equal rods are joined to form a single rod of 120 cm. Find final rod length when temperature is raised from 30°C to 100°C. Given: αA = 1.2 × 10⁻⁵/°C, αB = 24 × 10⁻⁶/°C:
questions.concept: Linear thermal expansion of composite rods

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A graph of potential energy as position is given below. Give the order of magnitude of forces.
questions.concept: Relationship between force and potential energy

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A rod of mass m and length ℓ is attached to two ideal strings. Find tension in left string just after right string is cut.
questions.concept: Torque and angular acceleration

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A capacitor of capacitance 'C' is given. Find the capacitance after dielectric is inserted as shown, with K = 3 and thickness d/3:
questions.concept: Parallel plate capacitor with partial dielectric

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A magnet is dropped inside a coil as shown in figure. Its acceleration as it falls through the coil is 'a'. Choose the correct option.
questions.concept: Opposition to motion due to induced current

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Two rods are joined together as shown. If moment of inertia about Hinge is (x/12)mℓ². Find x. (Both rods have mass m and length ℓ):
questions.concept: Moment of inertia of composite bodies

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Find energy required for a satellite to go from r = 1.5 RE to r = 3RE. (Given: Mass of satellite is 100 kg. Radius of Earth RE = 6 × 10⁶ m and acceleration due to gravity g = 10 m/s²):
questions.concept: Energy required to change orbital radius

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: A collimated beam of light of diameter 2mm is propagating along x-axis. The beam is required to be expanded in a collimated beam of diameter 14mm using a system of two convex lenses. If first lens has focal length 40mm then focal length of 2nd lens is:
questions.concept: Beam expander using two lenses

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: In YDSE arrangement d = 0.1 cm, D = 50 cm. If a thin film placed as in the figure in front of S₁ central maxima forms 0.2 cm above centre. The thickness of film should be (in μm). μ = 1.5:
questions.concept: Effect of thin film on fringe pattern

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Initial temperature of 10 moles O₂ is 30°C. Find change in internal energy (in calorie) if final temperature becomes 40°C. Given CP = 7 cal/(mole·°C), R = 2 cal/(mole·°C):
questions.concept: Change in internal energy of ideal gas

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Compound microscope has f₀ = 2 cm, fₑ = 4 cm and tube length = 32 cm. For normal adjustment find magnification:
questions.concept: Magnification of compound microscope

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: Find heat (in joule) dissipated in 1 minute in external circuit. Circuit has 9V battery with 1Ω internal resistance, external resistors 2Ω, 4Ω, 2Ω, 1Ω in Wheatstone bridge configuration:
questions.concept: Heat dissipation in Wheatstone bridge

questions.subject: PHYSICS
questions.questionText: There are two springs of spring constant k₁ = (20 ± 0.3) N/m and k₂ = (30 ± 0.2) N/m. If they are connected in parallel then percentage error in equivalent spring constant of combination is _____%.
questions.concept: Percentage error in parallel combination
